>Subject: Re: Kill Stealing
>
> SSSSSCCCCCCRRREEEEEEECCCCCCHHHH! Hold up, is there a way to stop or
limit Kill stealing? I have never heard any of this. Then, I am a melee
and am getting used to losing all my kills and buying from the wizzie who
stole from me. I am a level 23 paladin and would really like to keep a
kill. Been trying for a PGT, which is a complete waste of my time, since
most time is spent sitting. Then both times i get a shot at the muck, a
druid pops out of invis to steal the kill... 2 druids 2 different times. Is
there a way for me to prevent this? I just need a weapon to wield, and
don't like Everauction. I started on the PvP server, not teams, and guess
what... there is not kill stealing there. But short of replaying my 23
levels again, is there another way??? Please tell me if so. Lost the PGT 2
times, the chance at BBC about 9 times, the BIBS 6 times, the SBH way over
10 times.... this is getting old. For some reason it is usually a gnome
(any class), a druid, or a wiz!
>ard. :-( And I am helpless to do anything about it.
>
> Thanks
>
>

> Works better With pillage or nullify .. but basic when ever they come
in sight .. you dispel them .. dispelling sow while there Pulling past you
.. while there barely alive and the only thing holding them together are
buffs..
> I personally used this IN CT when We were camping the tae and This mid
20's group with one higher level Who Couldn't stand up to the Throne room
keep pulling the tae out past us after doing nothing but Sitting hidden/invs
outa eh way for it , were were clearing it and consatly fighting .. so
They pull take to much . There higher level wizard 34+ at least would nuke
tae they'd Loot and Zone, Got all my group member killed at one time or
another .. so Every time one of them Walk into the room , Dispelled nuked
.. that was after they tried to pull the tae from us again ..and we hit him
with pillage ,( wipes all Enchantments or spells off person.... the puller
went down in about 10 seconds
>
> we had given them tells before and all that Blah blah .. they Told us
to basically Mind our own .. and they could pull what they wanted ..when
they wanted ... hmm ok .. pull all ya want ..
>
> Dispelling RES Magic and Sow off a Puller is Not a Nice thing to do ...
but when they deserve it .. ( BTW we used Golem wands from the Steel to
make sure we did a good job)

>Message: 7
> Date: Tue, 10 Aug 1999 08:42:11 MST
> From: "Patrick Myers" <chrisstauf@...>
>Subject: Re: what trade window tactic?
>
>Well...here's how it works..you know how when you trade with someone the
>window comes up...you can't do anything else while its up..so you get one
of
>your group members or buddies to keep bringing up a trade window as soon as
>the baddie spawns. I'll give you an example..
>
>Im up on trainer mountain trying for the Shiny Brass Shield..I'm all by
>myself...I kill him couple of times..no shield..couple of people wander up
>and we agree to rotate...we do this for about an hour when this mage comes
>up..i inform him that the 4 of us have agreed to rotate to elimnate any
hard
>feelings..he informs me there is no rules or rotating and he will kill him
>all he wants..I inform mage'boy that i will do whatever it takes to prevent
>this including not playing fair. He tells me to go do something to
>myself...It was someone elses turn for the trainer..so as soon as he
spawned
>i start trading crushbone belts to him...he cant get off but one spell,
>cause i was a little slow with the mouse...the guy got his kill and the
mage
>left pissed...heheh..vengence was ours..
>
>I say let them ban me...i refuse to let kill stealers ruin a good time. I
>figure the worst they can do the first time is give me a warning and I have
>yet to even get that...the fact is they can turn off their trade
>window...but at least this gives you some ammo...
>
>good luck
>
>
>

> From: "Lanhdanan" <lanh@...>
>Subject: Re: trade window [LONG]

>Thats SO easy to get around its silly. Go to Options and limit what kind of
>ppl can trade with you, you can make it just group members, or make it so
>that you will not accept trades from anyone. Putting up the trade window is
>not a way at all to a person that knows his options in EQ, take a look
>sometime, you will be better off knowing what you can and cant do.
>the -kinda- best way is cancel magic, but even thats not so hot. he might
>just sit there and wait for the best time to strike, IE: When the critter
he
>wants is near half life and then nuke the snot out of it, so there is
>nothing you can do.
>
>one of the better ways was mentioned by Lanadina the Magician, and thats to
>back off. Let the wiz have his cake and then he might either leave, or get
>his ass handed back to him from the ensuing mob. In my personal travels
tho,
>the best way to beat a wiz, is with another wiz. if they are close in lvls
>your mage will have the advantage. I have sent many a wiz packing just cuz
i
>was faster and better than he was [and after that he offered us an INSANE
>amount of money for the item he wanted].
>
>but most of all, dont immediately go to dirty tactics when you see a wiz,
>talk to him, find out what he wants and see if the option of turns, or a
>line up, or just giving him the item [if none of your group want it] and
let
>him be on his way. the easiest method to do is talk IN A CALM AND
SENSE-ABLE
>MANNER. there are too many kids out there that just jump to conclusions and
>think that all wizards are KSers and start spamming OOC and generally
making
>an ass of themselves. sometimes Wizards dont see you kiting, or behind that
>hill and see a kill like anyother person. Wizs can shoot far so they dont
>have to be near to kill things. sometimes they think you are in trouble and
>just want to help out [for which i have been spammed SO much that i only
>help when asked now]
>
>take it easy, take some vallium, take your time, and HAVE FUN, if this game
>is causing you to have ulcers cuz of shiat like this, then step back, think
>of options, and plan what to do that doesnt resort to you showing the world
>what an immature person you are. [i no there are bad wizards out there, but
>truthfully, its a real LOW percentage that doesnt reflect the avg mentality
>of the wizards in Norrath]
>
>Vanya - Lv 20 Wizard - Quellious

>Message: 11
> Date: Tue, 10 Aug 1999 13:42:13 -0500
> From: "James J. Coolman" <coolman@...>
>Subject: Anti-kill Stealing Tactics
>
>In my experience, the Enchanters in the game are the very best at
preventing
>kill-theft.
>Most Classes are easy to stop.. Wizards, on the other hand are more
>troublesome. Their
>rapid-kill nuke spells are easily abused. Enchanters are wonderful at
>stopping that.
>Mesmerize not only scrambles the hate list, it blanks out the record of who
>did the most
>damage. After a Wizard fires a spell, Mesmerize it, and then whoever does
>the most damage
>out of the REMAINING hit points will get the xp. If you are lucky enough to
>get a spell
>off before the Wizard, Charm is most effective. The Wizard usually wastes
>all his mana
>before he realizes the creature is charmed, and can take NO DAMAGE from
him.
>If you use
>this tactic beware: when the charm expires the creature will hate you like
>no other.
>Be ready with your handy Mesmerization, and all is well... You or your
party
>will get the
>kill (and xp) while an impotent, mana-drained Wizard has to Meditate for a
>good while to
>recharge...
>
>I am very interested in other ways to handle the more frequent nuisance of
>kill-stealing.
>Any other tricks/strategies are great ammunition for those of us just
trying
>to have a
>little fun.
>
>Zirconia
>15th Lvl
>High Elf Enchantress
>Eci server
